greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the sum of all parts of all partitions of n into consecutive parts that differ by 4.
comment: The one-part partition n = n is included in the count.
example: For n = 28 there are three partitions of 28 into consecutive parts that differ by 4, including 28 as a valid partition. They are [28], [16, 12] and [13, 9, 5, 1]. The sum of the parts is [28] + [16 + 12] + [13 + 9 + 5 + 1] = 84, so a(28) = 84.
xref: Sequences of the same family where the parts differs by k are: A038040 (k=0), A245579 (k=1), A060872 (k=2), A334463 (k=3), this sequence (k=4), A334733 (k=5).
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 30 2020
